8E592E9ED549410EBB819BEA9F613562.description: Begin to comment on the ways that meaning can be expressed verbally and non-verbally in different contexts.

40F1B86469D449D0B0FE5764C9476025.description: Begin to evaluate own and others' talk, including what went well and what could be improved next time.

A11BD58F41924236B6CA4E35693F9E12.description: Plan and deliver a presentation independently on a familiar subject in a familiar context.

CF828FACD37B4C128630BDB7AB15CEFB.description: Use speech, gesture and movement to create a character in drama.

DF29A9C91F374DE194FFBF3409232A69.description: Use knowledge of punctuation and grammar to read familiar texts with accuracy.

7D0077B93CDF48CA8D8CC9E40A7CB7E5.description: Show awareness of different voices when reading aloud.

BD6CEA9E8A0F4EE99669D180E3DC7548.description: Read aloud with expression appropriate to the meaning and sound of the words.

E18E7CB9E24E492EAF2AD8D6FD4C3275.description: Take turns in a discussion, acknowledging what others have said.

BD947C2548A243DC94059F8DACD223ED.description: Extend a discussion by contributing relevant comments.

5BAEE1B1FEF04B9E84D8A9B09DF36C34.description: Respond politely to another point of view with a personal point of view.

2F966740359E4BB8B21A57CAFAFD0165.description: Begin to take an assigned role within a group.

D0F5FF62805F4FFCB798BF5F183E0CCF.description: Ask questions about what is heard or read that demonstrate understanding of the main points.

C64331B45F014CE694FBFE69F50EF64B.description: Listen and respond appropriately, including following a sequence of instructions to carry out an activity.

3397330E40F44701A81291ED02F53FAF.description: Show awareness of an audience, e.g. by adapting language and tone to engage them.

39A8A0CAF6DD48A2918C56E838972C0D.description: Use non-verbal communication techniques for different purposes.

6ADCF92B1BED411E80CB481307CE75C4.description: Use vocabulary appropriate to the situation.

C261A7A9B4324DF0898571926823E594.description: Select appropriate information, with appropriate detail, as needed.

069853EA8E6549A785B27866FA6CFB9B.description: Speak fluently and confidently in a range of familiar contexts.

D52B09CA78BB4C9D85A256FE6003C9BC.description: Proofread for grammar, spelling and punctuation errors, and make corrections, including using on-screen tools.

75D43C79DB6144E4B6EFA0D52518BFA9.description: Evaluate own and others’ writing, suggesting improvements for sense, accuracy and content.

7A81B068EB484D97B01BD82B70C44A32.description: Explore and use different ways of laying out and presenting texts to suit the purpose and audience (handwritten, printed and onscreen).

4E1B6D8966734FB0BFD7F5582B369DA7.description: Complete a table or diagram to record information drawn from a text.

EBA8286B0C404F8294ABEBAEA64C6B77.description: Begin to write legibly and fluently.

17FE4C473850406C8433DD9053F5A842.description: Develop writing of a range of text types for a specified audience, using appropriate content and language.

FF8E30A2D6F047538882235365AD7023.description: Develop writing for a purpose using language and features appropriate for a range of text types.

2004FE7B15044D51A697AF40BE1AFF02.description: Write a simple playscript based on a given narrative.

BBC9D729F5D14C66A9E3F2C407883CF2.description: Develop descriptions of settings and characters when writing stories.

4FB1222F17024BA695842291A3A04866.description: Plan and record main points and ideas before writing.

AF7C03E1599D47DBBB714F1F2FFFA178.description: Develop creative writing in a range of different genres of fiction and types of poems.

8904CFE7D015471CA83A2DCFDA4ABE62.description: Use organisational features appropriate to the text type, e.g. bulleted and numbered lists.

8062666BC24A44C39BD70E001C3FA264.description: Use sentence openings that establish links between ideas in different sentences, e.g. Later that day, …

33091E3F02F5414F9097CCCE5945809D.description: Begin to organise similar ideas in paragraphs and sections.

E44578350C2F4197B05D6A6A1A658D66.description: Write a logical sequence of events or ideas, e.g. to develop the plot of a story.

2DB82778B2924D52B007D17A437576DC.description: Use a range of prepositions accurately.

62E1D8A5DE6F452EA1A813022F86F81A.description: Use common irregular verb forms accurately in the past tense.

9A86E7BE06EE44618DF9A2FDEB5920EC.description: Use regular present and past verb forms accurately and consistently across a text.

D8270D18208D420B90A6092B82D164C6.description: Write multi-clause sentences using simple connectives of time, place and cause.

2BDA515E5E044754AF219C73A1F26603.description: Use different types of sentences and their grammar appropriately (statements, commands/instructions, questions and exclamations).

948903835BF94AD4B0307CA6D73758CF.description: Use speech marks to punctuate direct speech.

827DB5C1F29E419CBF7D438CF79F1378.description: Use apostrophes to mark omission of letters in shortened forms, e.g. can’t, don’t.

976753DF968A49158523178F5EA31A16.description: Use full stops, question marks and exclamation marks correctly in different types of sentences.

599C5E07104745158C54D3088C778A5D.description: Use own lists of interesting and significant words, dictionaries and thesauruses to extend the range of vocabulary used in written work.

5722E3EC89D84C80B886CD28EFC99A14.description: Use simple figurative language, including sound effects and simple onomatopoeia.

4384204DD6054667986A83BEFA770AEF.description: Choose and use words and phrases (including noun phrases) to strengthen the impact of writing.

DA2F84F461404DE88232186394E836C6.description: Use a variety of sentence openings, including using language of time, place and manner, e.g. Later that day, …; In the distance, …; Slowly and carefully, …

F2C2178E69B6470A85DD2E1B03A8EEA2.description: Explore and use different verbs for introducing and concluding dialogue, e.g. said, asked.

DC0D0A74453945709256E66F2C92BAB0.description: Explore and use synonyms for high frequency words, e.g. big, little, good.

B37F3B21E19945EA8C386EE98C2B0154.description: Use specialised vocabulary accurately to match a familiar topic.

715B88CAA71947BA94AFD615B8CE339E.description: Use paper-based and on-screen tools to find the correct spelling of words; keep and use spelling logs of misspelt words, and identify words that need to be learned.

E57F92838DC6460190E8364D2E17DFAD.description: Use effective strategies, including spelling patterns, visual memory, mnemonics and segmenting, to spell some unfamiliar regular and exception words correctly (including for compound words).

AEBB0417C9CC41FBB0DF25A600402A1F.description: Spell common homophones correctly to match their meaning, including to, two, too and right, write.

424309FAE0564628BBF48AE58D9A9DAE.description: Spell words with a range of common prefixes and suffixes, including re-, in-, -ment, -ness and -less.

8C566643107440DF81CB471E478D21B8.description: Use recognition of long and short vowel sounds and spelling rules to add -s, -ed and -ing to verbs, including omitting -e before -ing, and doubling consonants where necessary.

47F93D50A5284498A456971A1A9B2660.description: Explore and use common ways in which consonant phonemes can be represented, e.g. jar, giraffe, age, bridge; cat, kitten, brick.

F984CC3ADEC642258159EE240B76BA2B.description: Compare different retellings of the same story, including the influence of when and where they were written (e.g. myths and legends).

25683019152148E099F34589614B3BAF.description: Make choices about books to read for pleasure, including based on blurbs and reviews.

42A602FE3B134C019B7CB4AAE0C523F8.description: Share a review of a text, summarising what it is about and expressing opinions about it.

64B6750885A0479BA7A2A9C3249A93FB.description: Enjoy independent and shared reading of fiction genres, poems, playscripts and non-fiction texts.

CD8250160D1C4BB3BFD5D47612878B4B.description: Recognise the theme of a text, and common themes in different texts.

9AD33BABD235459C9226F6F765A476C3.description: Answer questions with some reference to single points in a text.

98A599B54BD04F84BA18B0C41322F72A.description: Locate relevant information in texts, including using an index.

FF8BBC23818841298575D192B96986BF.description: Scan a text to find and use specific information to answer a question.

8D88209B810C4D1A88F865CF16133804.description: Begin to distinguish between fact and opinion in texts.

59C3FD0DB4C541D68AC660E1CAB14D62.description: Make inferences from texts, including about the feelings, thoughts and motives of story characters.

65D90D08FB4141FEAD7EC05C076FC53D.description: Predict story endings based on knowledge of other stories.

F6C27F7879B541F8A7B63B24091F2A20.description: Explore implicit meanings in a range of texts.

37650DC1215F411991709EA3BD8FF8D7.description: Follow written instructions to carry out an activity.

4E2A4679A3E84F9493D3CF9D71A03CD4.description: Explain how settings and characters are developed in a story.

31246B3B895A433199C6F06217E3869B.description: Identify the main points or gist from reading a text.

1285C59FC9FB4FA9957D67385C209D54.description: Explore explicit meanings in a range of texts.

E155E554AB6246BB9C8004615475525D.description: Identify, discuss and compare the purposes and features of different non-fiction text types, including how texts engage the reader.

B7316AAB6EAB4098A08299C969802E4F.description: Read and explore a range of non-fiction text types.

E6230E2050F94191ADD0056C38D384AE.description: Identify, discuss and compare different fiction genres and their typical characteristics.

1A513E4476D94DDB88CC1149C7DB60E2.description: Read and explore a range of fiction genres, poems and playscripts, including identifying the contribution of any visual elements or multimedia.

6E0C470498FD4B5DABAF1955BBE4727B.description: Understand the difference between fiction and non-fiction texts and locate books by classification.

9A283FBAA8FC47AA86998FA971671887.description: Explore and recognise how sentence openings in texts establish links between sentences, e.g. Later that day, …

B9266582CDA54ACFAA0AFBAD42539E38.description: Explore and recognise different ways that information is organised in texts, including paragraphs, sections and chapters, and bulleted and numbered lists.

55FF3F1F4A4949CCBEA5E1F0C23146A7.description: Explore and recognise the key features of text structure in a range of different fiction and non-fiction texts, including poems and playscripts.

1618124D8BDB43B3B18804581CF9A7B5.description: Explore and describe how events or ideas in a text relate to earlier or later events or ideas.

AA1B44EBCF454195B91A5BE6417E91F1.description: Identify common irregular verb forms in the past tense and relate them to the present tense.

424DD61FCADC4D1BB2D85A866B47F2A6.description: Explore and identify past and present verb forms in texts, including irregular verbs.

B230F51BA0A84E448BADE7AB00F62067.description: Explore the different purposes of prepositions.

52296A2DDB1549D5B13CF4B68D72C371.description: Identify nouns, pronouns, verbs and adjectives in texts.

F263D17B744B45F6A9942FE46933E6E6.description: Explore the purpose and grammar of nouns, verbs and adjectives in sentences.

47553CF9A4BF49C4AA4090C9F32F7C8E.description: Explore in texts, and understand, the grammar of multi-clause sentences, including conditional sentences.

94F00C0968604EFC9F87A0F675CCAD0A.description: Explore in texts, and understand, the grammar and purpose of different types of sentences (statements, commands/instructions, questions and exclamations).

12525FFF5E434B29998D0CEFBBB5D244.description: Explore in texts, and understand, similarities and differences between the punctuation of narrative and direct speech.

CAD3AA553A994BCC94424B0F7492AD88.description: Explore in texts, and understand, the use of apostrophes to mark omission of letters in shortened forms, e.g. can't, don't.

067C96078FA140F8B3D460F8F077BCC1.description: Explore in texts, and understand, the use of exclamation marks.

D0AA5FA35EE241EB93ECC0653005F882.description: Use knowledge of punctuation and grammar to read familiar texts with understanding.

3A4E86F799944D1B8DF12DACEF8ED8A0.description: Identify simple figurative language in texts, including sound effects and simple onomatopoeia.

62E3226D18E2480681C33021FB87F81C.description: Explore how different sentence openings are used for different purposes, including time, place and manner, e.g. Later that day, …; In the distance, …; Slowly and carefully, …

C30D4E04E70847EFBB7104115854DD52.description: Explore and comment on how a writer's choice of verbs to introduce and conclude dialogue enhances the meaning.

3C8AD3FD2BEA4FE289CDB377D002AFAB.description: Explore and comment on words in texts that make an impact on the reader, including noun phrases and adjectives.

2338E392B13C4F3AA8F54595499391DD.description: Use the initial two letters to organise words in alphabetical order, and to locate words in dictionaries and glossaries.

55B1F7B94B84452AB5BD88CBC482FDBD.description: Identify and record interesting and significant words, and synonyms, from texts to inform own writing.

4EF28EE4919E4D2E94DB607D765EFEE8.description: Deduce the meanings of unfamiliar words from their context.

E788F97A29F84D16A048E8389BFFAE3D.description: Extend the range of common words recognised on sight, including homophones and near-homophones.

EAD9C8B1523A4302A14FCCB4AEA70F18.description: Use effective strategies to read unfamiliar words, including using phonic knowledge, segmenting and contextual information.

158EEEC426174430BABA4E8DF0CC5E14.description: Read words with an apostrophe to mark omission of letters, e.g. can't, don't.

705ABDA3B9A243BAB5551F00FF0445F6.description: Identify less common ways in which graphemes can be pronounced, e.g. young, could; move, love.
